com.atakmap.android.hierarchy

Interface HierarchyListItem2

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HierarchyListItem
    All Known Implementing Classes:

    public interface HierarchyListItem2
extends HierarchyListItem
    Hierarchical list model inspired by javax.swing.tree.TreeNode. Now with a lot more control over display and layout

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.atakmap.android.hierarchy.HierarchyListItem

        Deprecated. Use refresh(HierarchyListFilter)
        Description copied from interface: HierarchyListItem
        Refreshes this node's descendants on the specified sort. If the specified sort cannot be supported, the current sort remains unchanged.

      • refresh

        HierarchyListFilter refresh(HierarchyListFilter filter)
        Refreshes this node's descendants on the specified filter and sort. If the specified sort cannot be supported, the current sort remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        filter - The new sort
        Returns:
        The filter that is actually being used.

        android.view.View getListItemView(android.view.View convertView,
                                  android.view.ViewGroup parent)
        Used when this item is being displayed within a list For overriding the entire list view, see getCustomLayout()
        Parameters:
        convertView - The existing list item view. Only inflate a new layout if the id/context do not match your expected config.
        parent - The list view parent - Use this as "root" when inflating
        Returns:
        List item view

      • getExtraView

        android.view.View getExtraView(android.view.View convertView,
                               android.view.ViewGroup parent)
        Same as HierarchyListItem.getExtraView() except the existing view is provided This is to allow more efficient view cycling when scrolling through OM
        Parameters:
        convertView - The existing extra view. Only inflate a new layout if the id/context do not match your expected config.
        parent - The extra view parent - Use this as "root" when inflating
        Returns:
        Extra view

      • getDropDownSize

        double[] getDropDownSize()
        Get the preferred drop-down size for displaying this list Width is used in landscape mode, height is used in portrait mode
        Returns:
        [width, height] ratios (1 being full screen) [-1, -1] to use default size
